alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Gallatin; Wabash; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 10:52AM CDT until April 10 at 8:12AM CDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Petersburg and Hazleton. Wabash River from Lafayette to Mount Carmel. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the Wabash River and the lowest portions of the White. Minor flooding along the lowest reaches of the White will continue at least into the weekend and along the Wabash River into next week. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. The White River has crest and is falling. A secondary crest on the Wabash is at Covington late Monday morning. Additional rainfall expected through Wednesday may prolong flooding along the Wabash River and lower White. Those with interests along these rivers should monitor forecast updates. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Mount Carmel. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.5 feet, Extensive lowland flooding in progress. Much of the flood plain activity is affected by high water. Numerous local river roads flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Monday /10:00 AM EDT Monday/ the stage was 24.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CDT Monday /10:00 AM EDT Monday/ was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
